description: {"blocks":[{"key":"dk9kn","text":"Protocol for performing Datsenko-Wanner deletions of C. portucalensis MBL genes based on https://doi.org/10.1073/pnas.120163297","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":53,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":89,"length":38}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"1DC575D582BA11EE982A0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://doi.org/10.1073/pnas.120163297"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: Amplify the resistance cassette for knocking out a genetic region of interest using the appropriate primer pairs. Use a high-fidelity polymerase, such as Q5, KAPA, or Phusion according to manufacturer instructions.
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f40qr","text":"Design primers for replacing the gene locus of interest with a Kanamycin resistance casette via homologous recombination.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Amplify the resistance cassette for knocking out a genetic region of interest using the appropriate primer pairs. Use a high-fidelity polymerase, such as Q5, KAPA, or Phusion according to manufacturer instructions.
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b6d0r","text":"Design primers with 36 bp homology upstream to/downstream from region you want to knock out.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Amplify the resistance cassette for knocking out a genetic region of interest using the appropriate primer pairs. Use a high-fidelity polymerase, such as Q5, KAPA, or Phusion according to manufacturer instructions.
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"93cuk","text":"Append GTGTAGGCTGGAGCTGCTTC to 3' end of upstream primer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Amplify the resistance cassette for knocking out a genetic region of interest using the appropriate primer pairs. Use a high-fidelity polymerase, such as Q5, KAPA, or Phusion according to manufacturer instructions.
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fln05","text":"Append CATATGAATATCCTCCTTAG to 3' end of downstream primer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Amplify the resistance cassette for knocking out a genetic region of interest using the appropriate primer pairs. Use a high-fidelity polymerase, such as Q5, KAPA, or Phusion according to manufacturer instructions.
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9784d","text":"Use pKD4 for KanR cassette template.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Amplify the resistance cassette for knocking out a genetic region of interest using the appropriate primer pairs. Use a high-fidelity polymerase, such as Q5, KAPA, or Phusion according to manufacturer instructions.
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1lt1h","text":"Use Phusion polymerase for PCR: approx. 15 ng plasmid template per reaction","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9aq6j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"co1np","text":"1) 98 ºC 30 sec.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ajm84","text":"2) 98 ºC 5 sec.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"faoa0","text":"3) 55 ºC 30 sec.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5e2a8","text":"4) 72 ºC 54 sec.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3bam6","text":"5) Go to step 2 24 times","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"au07n","text":"6) 72 ºC 5 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8svng","text":"7) hold at 22 ºC or refrigerate/freeze until use","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"daid8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"69nkl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Amplify the resistance cassette for knocking out a genetic region of interest using the appropriate primer pairs. Use a high-fidelity polymerase, such as Q5, KAPA, or Phusion according to manufacturer instructions.
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fs75o","text":"Purify PCR products using NEB PCR cleanup kit (Cat. No. T1030) after gel verification.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ajpv3","text":"Plate 300 µL of recovered cell suspension on LB + 50 µg/mL kanamycin and grow at 37 ºC. Leave remaining cell suspension standing overnight and plate the next day if nothing grows from the first attempt.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"beu33","text":"Cure pKD46 plasmid and confirm deletion","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"61oi8","text":"Pick a couple individual colonies for each transformation and re-streak on non-selective LB to grow at 42 ºC overnight (pKD46 has a temperature-sensitive origin of replication).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9vo1c","text":"From each re-streak, pick a single colony to patch onto non-selective LB, LB/Kan, and LB/Carb or Amp. Grow at 30 ºC.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e3oti","text":"Check for colonies that are kanamycin-resistant and carbenicillin/ampicillin-sensitive.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6iqlt","text":"PCR verify correct insertion of kanamycin resistance cassette (forward primer in KanR and reverse downstream from knocked out region and loss of λRed (primers in λRed gene on pKD46).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"am6f0","text":"Prepare -80C stocks for good strains in 35% glycerol from cured overnight cultures grown in LB + 50 µg/mL kanamycin.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"34i2r","text":"FLP out resistance cassette","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5pohu","text":"Electroporate pCP20 (AmpR, ts-origin) into cured deletion strains. See: dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.kqdg3x7r7g25/v1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9ffnm","text":"Recover in LB at 30 ºC for 1 hour.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"f0u87","text":"Plate 100 µL to grow overnight on LB/Carb or Amp plate at 30 ºC.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"acqic","text":"Streak several colonies on non-selective LB and grow at 42 ºC overnight (the pCP20 plasmid also has a temperature-sensitive origin of replication).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d069b","text":"Screen for loss of all antibiotic resistance by patching on non-selective and selective LB plates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ba39u","text":"Confirm FRT scar by PCR using primers in flanking regions (e.g., ∆nap_check_F and ∆nap_check_R) and sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7bf9q","text":"Transfer cell suspension to microcentrifuge tube and recover at 37 ºC shaking horizontally for an hour.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"82i8q","text":"Add 500 µL LB to each cuvette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3htsv","text":"Electroporate in ice-cold cuvettes using 2.5 kV, 250 Ω, and 25 µF (confirm approx. 5 ms pulse for each), assuming 2 mm gap cuvettes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ccgqe","text":"Add approximately 100 ng resistance cassette to cell aliquot and gently mix by tapping.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2cv2k","text":"Aliquot 100 µL reaction volumes into ice-cold microcentrifuge tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"arr0j","text":"Resuspend into 400 µL final vol 10% glycerol (assuming four reactions--100 µL per reaction).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"40unl","text":"Wash at 2000 x g (slow deceleration) at 4 ºC into ice-cold 10% glycerol three times, combining final aliquot in one tube during last wash.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2u3ho","text":"Grow at 30 ºC to OD600 approx. 0.6-0.8 (around 2 hours).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a384q","text":"Morning of, inoculate 2 mL overnight culture into 100 mL (25 mL per transformation) LB with 50 µg/mL Amp/Carb and 0.2% L-arabinose.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3jadp","text":"One day prior, grow overnight culture in 5 mL LB with 50 µg/mL Amp/Carb.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cucu","text":"Two days prior, streak out C. portucalensis MBL/pKD46 on 50 µg/mL ampicillin (Amp) or carbenicillin (Carb) LB agar at 30 ºC.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":27,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3i532","text":"Electroporate the antibiotic resistance casette (PCR product from Step 3) into C. portucalensis MBL carrying pKD46 (the λRed plasmid)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":79,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: DatsenkoWannerCportucalensis
